Process household census 1 Introduction
Process household census 2025-10-02 1 Introduction This document cleans and processes data from the household census.
import-household-census-data.html
2 Import household census data 2.1 Load data 2.2 Combine Uganda and Malawi data 2.3 Adjust variable formats 2.4 Explore data 2.5 Save into R format

2 Import household census data packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "janitor" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 2.1 Load data Corrections to the raw data were done by IPA. We load the dataset that already includes these corrections. hh_raw_ug <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "Data - SHARED WITH IPA", "Uganda", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "2_HH Census", "DIL Household Census_checked.dta" ) ) hh_raw_ug_ilc <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "Data - SHARED WITH IPA", "Uganda", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "2_HH Census", "ILC", "2_dta", "DIL Household Census_checked_V3.dta" ) ) hh_raw_mw <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "Data - SHARED WITH IPA", "Malawi", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "2_household_census", "DIL_Household_Census_checked_Malawi.dta" ) ) 2.2 Combine Uganda and Malawi data We want to conduct the wrangling and HFCs for both countries at the same time, so we combine them here. hhc_raw <- hh_raw_mw %>% bind_rows(hh_raw_ug) %>% bind_rows(hh_raw_ug_ilc) 2.3 Adjust variable formats hhc_raw <- hhc_raw %>% as_factor(levels = "labels") %>% mutate( duration = as.numeric(duration), country_pl = ifelse(key == "uuid:447617f9-4a55-40a2-ac71-6a11f2802fff", "Malawi", country_pl) ) %>% remove_empty() ## value for "which" not specified, defaulting to c("rows", "cols") 2.4 Explore data There are 194 variables in the water point census data. The level of observation is a household. Main location variables are district_pl, village_pl, gpslongitude, gpslatitude. 2.5 Save into R format path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Raw", "hh-census-corrected" ) hhc_raw 3 Clean Household Census 3.1 Create unique ID 3.2 Corrections 3.3 Replace NAs 3.4 Clean text variables 3.5 Drop SurveyCTO coding variables 3.6 Clean date of survey 3.7 Convert factors into dummy variables 3.8 Clean location variables 3.9 Export data

3 Clean Household Census packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "janitor", "assertthat" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) hhc_raw <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Raw", "hh-census-corrected.rds" ) ) 3.1 Create unique ID We check the uniqueness of the key variable. assert_that( n_distinct(hhc_raw$key) == nrow(hhc_raw) ) ## [1] TRUE assert_that( n_distinct(hhc_raw$household_id) == nrow(hhc_raw) ) ## [1] TRUE 3.2 Corrections hhc_corrected <- hhc_raw %>% mutate( across( village_id_pl, ~ case_when( . == "1050304002" ~ "1050702004", TRUE ~ . ) ) ) 3.3 Replace NAs In the case that a character variable has “-999” or “9999” as its input, we can replace this entry with NA, since these entries correspond to responses saying “do not know” or “cannot tell.” We also impute “.” as NAs, converting these too. -666 corresponds to “other,” but we deal with this later. hhc_clean <- hhc_corrected %>% mutate( across( where(is.character) & !where(is.factor), ~ . %>% na_if("[.]") %>% na_if("") %>% na_if("-999") %>% na_if("9999") ), across( where(is.numeric), ~ na_if(., -999) %>% na_if(9999) ) ) 3.4 Clean text variables hhc_clean <- hhc_clean %>% mutate( across( (ends_with("_pl") | matches("name") | matches("comment")) & !any_of(c("country_pl", "village_pl")), ~ . %>% str_squish %>% str_to_upper ) ) 3.5 Drop SurveyCTO coding variables hhc_clean <- hhc_clean %>% select( -c( gen_formid, hh_randnum, randomdraw_bc, gen_label_hhsurvey, temp_hh_id, country, countryl, key_pl ) ) 3.6 Clean date of survey hhc_clean <- hhc_clean %>% mutate( date = as_date(submissiondate) ) 3.7 Convert factors into dummy variables Recoding the values: - 1 ~ Yes - 0 ~ No, - 9999 ~ Don’t know - NA ~ Missing hhc_clean <- hhc_clean %>% mutate( across( where(~ all(unique(.) %in% c(0, 1, NA))), ~ as.logical(.) ), across( where(is_dummy), ~ (. == "Yes") ), across( where( ~ (is.factor(.) | is.character(.)) & (all(levels(.) %in% c("Don't know", "No", "Yes"))) ), ~ case_when( . == "Yes" ~ TRUE, . == "No" ~ FALSE ), .names = "{.col}_c" ) ) 3.8 Clean location variables hhc_clean <- hhc_clean %>% # sometimes, the country pull is missing. Instead of waiting for IPA to correct the data, we can get it from the enumerator ID to avoid the code breaking in script 6. mutate( country_pl = case_when( is.na(country_pl) & str_detect(enumerator_id, "MW") ~ "Malawi", is.na(country_pl) & !str_detect(enumerator_id, "MW") ~ "Uganda", TRUE ~ country_pl ) ) %>% mutate( country = country_pl %>% str_to_title %>% as_factor, district_id = coalesce(districtmw, districtug), district_name = district_pl %>% str_to_title %>% as_factor, village_name = village_name_pl %>% str_to_title %>% as_factor, village_id = village_id_pl, longitude_c = coalesce(gpslongitude, gps_altlongitude), latitude_c = coalesce(gpslatitude, gps_altlatitude), altitude_c = coalesce(gpsaltitude, gps_altaltitude), accuracy_c = coalesce(gpsaccuracy, gps_altaccuracy), missing_gps = is.na(longitude_c) | is.na(latitude_c) ) 3.9 Export data path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-census-clean" ) hhc_clean %>% write_meta( path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 3.1: Data summary Name Piped data Number of rows 24002 Number of columns 300 _______________________ 5 Construct household distance 5.1 Load data 5.2 Compute distances 5.3 Export data

5 Construct household distance In this script, we compute the distances between households. packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "sf" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 5.1 Load data hh_sf <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Spatial", "hh-gps.rds" ) ) hh <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-census-clean.rds" ) ) 5.2 Compute distances We separate data frame into district-level data frames to reduce run time and calculate distances between all water points in the same district. hh_district <- hh_sf %>% group_by(district_id) %>% group_split %>% map( ~ st_distance_df( ., "key", ., "key" ) ) %>% bind_rows() %>% dplyr::filter( key.x != key.y ) 5.3 Export data path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-distances" ) hh_district %>% write_meta( path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 5.1: Data summary Name Piped data Number of rows 31170588 Number of columns 3 _______________________ Column type frequency: character 2 numeric 1 ________________________ Group variables None Variable type: character skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max empty n_unique whitespace key.x 0 1 41 41 0 21800 0 key.y 0 1 41 41 0 21800 0 Variable type: numeric skim_variable n_missing complete_rate mean sd p0 p25 p50 p75 p100 hist distance 0 1 20946.74 14752.74 0 9379.14 19671.52 32007.95 86882.76 ▇▆▃▁▁

6 Construct primary water point packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "sf", "janitor" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 6.1 Load data hhc_clean <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-census-clean.rds" ) ) wp_corrections <- read_csv( file.path( path_git, "documentation", "HouseholdCensus", "manual-wp-match.csv" ) ) %>% mutate( village_id = as.character(village_id), wp_id_fixed = wp_id ) ## Rows: 9 Columns: 3 ## ── Column specification ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (2): wp_name, wp_id ## dbl (1): village_id ## ## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. 6.2 Primary water point hhc_wp <- hhc_clean %>% dplyr::filter(consent) %>% left_join(wp_corrections) %>% transmute( household_id, date, country, wp_source, wp_source_o, wp_name_c = coalesce(wp_name, wp_name_coa), wp_id = coalesce(wp_id_fixed, wp_id_pl), flag_wp_id = is.na(wp_id_pl), wp_match, wp_match_comments ) ## Joining with `by = join_by(wp_name, village_id)` hhc_wp %>% dplyr::filter(is.na(wp_id)) %>% tabyl(wp_source) ## wp_source n percent ## Other 53 0.027446919 ## From a water point in this village 287 0.148627654 ## create-final-household-census-data.html
7 Create final household census data 7.1 Load data 7.2 Construct final indicators 7.3 Combine and save data

7 Create final household census data packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "sf", "assertthat" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 7.1 Load data 7.1.1 Household census hhc_clean <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-census-clean.rds" ) ) hhc_gps <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Spatial", "hh-gps.rds" ) ) %>% select(-district_id) 7.1.2 Water point census wp <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "WaterPointCensus", "DataSets", "Constructed", "wp-constructed.rds" ) ) %>% transmute( wp_id_c, hh_dsw = dsw, hh_ilc = ilc, wp_func, wp_intervention_type = intervention_type %>% as.factor, wp_sourcetype = sourcetype, wp_turbidity, wp_pay, wp_dsw_valve = jc_valve, wp_dsw_chlorine = jc_chlorine, wp_dsw_dose = jc_mldispensed, wp_meterfcr = meterfcr, wp_metertcr = metertcr, wp_discfcr = discfcr, wp_disctcr = disctcr, wp_meterfcr_un = meterfcr_un, wp_metertcr_un = metertcr_un, wp_discfcr_un = discfcr_un, wp_disctcr_un = disctcr_un, wp_meterfcr_01 = meterfcr_c_01, wp_metertcr_01 = metertcr_c_01, wp_meterfcr_un_01 = meterfcr_un_c_01, wp_metertcr_un_01 = metertcr_un_c_01, wp_meterfcr_02 = meterfcr_c_02, wp_metertcr_02 = metertcr_c_02, wp_discfcr_02 = discfcr_c_02, wp_disctcr_02 = disctcr_c_02, wp_meterfcr_un_02 = meterfcr_un_c_02, wp_metertcr_un_02 = metertcr_un_c_02, wp_discfcr_un_02 = discfcr_un_c_02, wp_disctcr_un_02 = disctcr_un_c_02 ) %>% st_drop_geometry() %>% unique 7.1.3 Villages villages <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "Villages", "DataSets", "Final", "Villages.rds" ) ) %>% rename( ea_dsw = dsw, ea_n_dsw_vil = dsw_wpt, ea_ilc = ilc, ea_n_ilc_wp_vil = ilc_wpt, ea_n_ilc_wcp_vil = ilc_wcp ) 7.2 Construct final indicators 7.2.1 Non-responses hhc_visit <- hhc_clean %>% dplyr::filter(is.na(visit_reschedule) | visit_reschedule != "Yes, I will schedule a revisit") %>% transmute( household_id, visit_outcome = case_when( consent ~ "Surveyed", visit_notfound == "No revisit: There is no eligible respondent in the household" ~ "No eligible respondent", str_detect(visit_notfound, "inaccessible") ~ "Household not accessible", !consent | listing_status == "Respondent Declined" ~ "Declined", TRUE ~ "Respondent not available" ), response = visit_outcome == "Surveyed", inclusion = visit_reason ) 7.2.2 ID variables hhc_ids <- hhc_clean %>% transmute( household_id, date, key, village_id ) 7.2.3 Household head characteristics Some of these questions were moved from the household survey into the household census toward the end of data collection, to make the household survey shorter. hhc_hhh <- hhc_clean %>% transmute( household_id, hhh_resp = resp_relationship, hhh_gender = gender_hhh, hhh_age, hhh_educ = case_when( # Uganda hh_educ %in% c("Never attended school / did not complete class", "Informal Training") ~ "None", hh_educ %in% c("Pre-primary", "P1", "P2", "P3", "P4", "P5", "P6") ~ "Pre-primary", hh_educ %in% c("P7", "PLE", "S1", "S2", "S3") ~ "Primary", hh_educ %in% c("S4", "O level", "S5", "S6", "A level", "Polytechnic") ~ "Secondary", hh_educ %in% c("College (non-University)", "University") ~ "Post-secondary", # Malawi hh_educ_mw == "No formal education / Never attended school" ~ "None", hh_educ_mw == "Some Primary School (Did not complete Standard 8)" ~ "Pre-primary", hh_educ_mw %in% c("Primary School Leaving Certificate (PSLCE) (Completed Standard 8)", "Junior Certificate of Education (JCE) (Completed Form 2)") ~ "Primary", hh_educ_mw %in% c("Malawi School Certificate of Education (MSCE) (Completed Form 4)", "Vocational/Technical Training (e.g., TEVETA certification)") ~ "Secondary", hh_educ_mw %in% c("Diploma (e.g., teaching, nursing, other post-secondary diploma)", "Bachelor's Degree") ~ "Post-secondary" ) ) 7.2.4 Household composition These questions were moved into the household census from the household survey a few weeks after data collection had started. hhc_hhmembers <- hhc_clean %>% dplyr::filter(!is.na(hh_members)) %>% transmute( household_id, hh_hhsincompound, hh_members, hh_adults, hh_males, hh_females, any_children = hh_adults < hh_members, hh_pregnant = if_else(hh_females == 0, 0, hh_pregnant), hh_under5n = if_else(any_children, hh_under5, 0), hh_under5yn = hh_under5n > 0, hh_under2n = if_else(any_children, hh_under2, 0), hh_under2yn = hh_under2n > 0, ) assert_that( hhc_hhmembers %>% dplyr::filter( !(household_id %in% c("CHPU54248MW2", "ZOZ243113MW2", "MAMX13147MW2")), is.na(hh_adults) ) %>% nrow == 0 ) ## [1] TRUE 7.2.5 Water point use “Other” options need to be explored It seems like some people may not have understood the question, as they are saying why the closest point is not their preferred water point hhc_wpuse <- hhc_clean %>% select( household_id, wp_freq, wp_sec_notworking = wp_secwhen_1, wp_sec_inadequate = wp_secwhen_2, wp_sec_intermitent = wp_secwhen_3, wp_sec_notfixed = wp_secwhen_4, wp_sec_crowded = wp_secwhen_5, wp_sec_other = wp_secwhen__666, wp_sec_specify = wp_secwhen_o, wp_secweek, wp_secweekno ) %>% mutate( wp_sec_crowded = case_when( str_detect( wp_sec_specify, regex("crowd|people|too many|line|queue|que|wait|congestion|congested|population|conjestion", ignore_case = TRUE) ) ~ TRUE, is.na(wp_sec_crowded) ~ FALSE, TRUE ~ as.logical(wp_sec_crowded) ), wp_sec_other = if_else( wp_sec_crowded, FALSE, wp_sec_other ), wp_count_pastmonth = case_when( wp_secweek ~ wp_secweekno + 1, !wp_secweek ~ 1 ) ) 7.2.6 Primary water points hhc_primarywp <- hhc_clean %>% transmute( household_id, village_id, wp_id_pl, wp_id_c = case_when( !is.na(wp_id_pl) ~ paste0(village_id, str_sub(wp_id_pl, str_length(wp_id_pl) - 2, str_length(wp_id_pl))) ), wp_identified = !is.na(wp_id_c), wp_invillage = wp_source == "From a water point in this village" ) %>% mutate( wp_id_c = case_when( wp_id_pl == "WP2050904017004" ~ "2101349269002", wp_id_pl == "WP2060102007003" ~ "2101338209002", wp_id_pl == "WP2050904017005" ~ "2050902005003", wp_id_pl == "WP2050902006025" ~ "2010503012001", wp_id_pl %in% c("WP008", "WP1471008", "WP2101433260028") ~ NA, TRUE ~ wp_id_c ) ) # This is the code we used to make the manual checks hhc_primarywp %>% select(household_id, village_id, wp_id_c, wp_id_pl) %>% na.omit %>% anti_join(wp) %>% left_join( hhc_clean %>% select(wp_id_pl, wp_name_coa) %>% unique ) %>% unique 7.2.7 Non-users knowledge “Other” methods need to be cleaned hhc_noevac <- hhc_clean %>% select( household_id, vil_dsw_selfreport = wtmt_dsw_c, vil_ilc_selfreport = wtmt_ilc_c, wtmt_none = wtmt_method_0, wtmt_pretreated = wtmt_method__111, wtmt_boil = wtmt_method_1, wtmt_dispcl = wtmt_method_2, wtmt_othercl = wtmt_method_3, wtmt_strain = wtmt_method_4, wtmt_filter = wtmt_method_5, wtmt_sand = wtmt_method_6, wtmt_solar = wtmt_method_7, wtmt_decant = wtmt_method_8, wtmt_other = wtmt_method__666, wtmt_specify = wtmt_method_o ) %>% mutate( # indicator for any chlorination (whether home or dispenser) wtmt_anycl = wtmt_dispcl == 1 | wtmt_othercl == 1 ) 7.2.8 Meta data hhc_meta <- hhc_clean %>% select( household_id, formdef_version, comments, endcomment, review_comments ) 7.2.9 Flags hhc_flags <- hhc_clean %>% select( household_id, contains("flag") ) 7.3 Combine and save data 7.3.1 Only final indicators indexes <- hhc_ids %>% left_join(villages, relationship = "many-to-one") %>% inner_join(hhc_visit, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_hhh, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_hhmembers, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_wpuse, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_noevac, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_meta, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_flags, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(hhc_primarywp, relationship = "one-to-one") %>% left_join(wp, relationship = "many-to-one") ## Joining with `by = join_by(village_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(household_id, village_id)` ## Joining with `by = join_by(wp_id_c)` nrow(indexes) == n_distinct(indexes$household_id) ## [1] TRUE indexes <- indexes %>% mutate( wp_intervention_type = case_when( # If the household is using a water point outside of the village, it is not using one of the village's EvAc water points !wp_invillage ~ "Non-program", # If the household is using a water point inside the village, but it wasn't mapped, then it is not an EvAc water point wp_invillage & is.na(wp_intervention_type) ~ "Non-program", TRUE ~ as.character(wp_intervention_type) ) %>% factor ) 7.3.2 Analysis data final <- indexes %>% set_names( names(.) %>% str_remove_all("_c$") ) %>% dplyr::filter(!vil_replaced) %>% remove_empty() ## value for "which" not specified, defaulting to c("rows", "cols") path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Final", "hh-census" ) final %>% write_meta( path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 7.1:
